answerText: Curling [Prompt on "That damn thing with the brooms"][10] Surrounding the button are 3 concentric circles that are red, white, and blue and located at 4, 8, and 12 feet respectively. That area in which rocks must land  to score is known by this term.
heading: Penn Bowl |2012 | Editors Packet 1 | 14 | Trash | None | College
subject: Trash
question: Question: Invented in Scotland, this sport used to exclusively use  Blue Hone granite to make its rocks and puts Teflon sliding pads on one shoe of participants. For 10 points each: [10] Name this Olympic sport which features a thrower, 2 sweepers and a skip trying to land their shots as close to the button as possible. It called "Chess on Ice" for its high level of strategy.
